peril.model.combat

Class Test_CombatRound

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.model.combat.Test_CombatRound

  • public final class Test_CombatRound
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests that CombatRound is constructed properly and only with valid parameters.
    Since:
    2018-03-12
    Version:
    1.01.03
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    CombatRound

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<ModelUnit> testArmyUnits
      The List of ModelUnits that will make up a standard ModelArmy.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Test_CombatRound() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Sets up the testArmyUnits that will be used by every test.
      void test_attackSquad_toBig()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the attacking squad is to large.
      void test_defendSquad_toBig()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the defend squad is to large.
      void test_emptySquads()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if empty ModelSquads are used for the combat.
      void test_friendlyCountrys()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the countries fighting are ruled by the same player.
      void test_normal()
      Tests that the CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) performs properly when given valid parameters.
      void test_sameCountry()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the countries fighting are the same country.
      void test_sameSquad()
      Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException when the proposed CombatRound has the attacking squad and defending squad are the same squad.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • test_sameSquad

        public void test_sameSquad()
        Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException when the proposed CombatRound has the attacking squad and defending squad are the same squad.

      • test_friendlyCountrys

        public void test_friendlyCountrys()
        Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the countries fighting are ruled by the same player.

        Tests that CombatRound.CombatRound(ModelCountry, ModelCountry, ModelSquad, ModelSquad) throws an IllegalArgumentException if the countries fighting are the same country.

        public void test_defendSquad_toBig()
